alternative_names: 忠虎; Tadatora; 庄左衛門正虎; Shozaemon Masatora; 三代
notes: Third generation Akasaka master. Full name: Shozaemon Masatora (庄左衛門正虎). Counted among the "three great masters of Akasaka school".

alternative_names: 浜野政随; 味墨; Miboku; 乙柳軒; Otsuryuken; 太郎兵衛; Tarobei; Hamano Masayuki; Masayuki; 龝峰斎; Shuhosai
notes: Founder of Hamano school (1696-1769). Studied under Nara Toshinaga. Art names: Otsuryuken Miboku. Known for takabori.

alternative_names: 林藤八; Hayashi Tōhachi; Hayashi Tohachi; 三代林; Tohachi
notes: Third generation Hayashi master. Known as "a great and much sought after artist" equaled with founder Matashichi.
Major Hazama school artist. Pieces signed simply "間" (Hazama) are attributed to him. Known for sahari inlay.

alternative_names: 貞映; Teiei; 国友貞映; Kunitomo Teiei; 国友貞秀
notes: Also read as Teiei. Signed works as "Kunitomo Teiei" (国友貞映). From Kunitomo gunsmith family.
One of the two best-known Hazama artists alongside Teiei.

alternative_names: 亀山派; Kameyama; 間; Hazama-ha
notes: Non-specific school attribution. Also known as Kameyama school (亀山派). Known for sahari inlay.
1st gen. Hirata Hikozo (平田彦三), founder of Hirata school. Retainer of Hosokawa Sansai. Part of Shoami tradition. One of four major Higo kinko schools.
3rd gen. Kamiyoshi Rakuju. Son of Fukanobu, grandson of Tadamitsu. Higo Kamiyoshi school.
Non-specific style attribution: Kyoto openwork (sukashi) tsuba

alternative_names: 山光堂; Sankōdō; Sankodo; 賀茂氏孫山光堂如水
notes: Rare female tosogu artist. Art name: Sankodo (山光堂). Descended from Kamo family of Kyoto. Listed in Soken Kisho (1781).
Myochin school - famous armor/tsuba makers from Kamakura period. Top class iron metalworkers.
1st gen. Nishigaki Kanshiro (西垣勘四郎). One of the best tsuba makers in Japanese history. Higo school.
Shimizu school - one of four major Higo kinko schools. Founded by Shimizu Jingo, nephew of Hirata Hikozo.
Shimizu Jingo (志水甚五). Nephew of Hirata Hikozo. Founder of Shimizu school, one of four major Higo kinko schools.
Shimizu Jingo - alternative kanji (甚吾 vs 甚五).

alternative_names: 一乗; 伯応; Hakuō; Hakuo; 凸凹山人; Totsuo-sanjin; 凸凹翁; 夢竜; Muryū; 栄次郎; Eijirō
notes: Last great Goto master (1791-1876). Used Hakuo pseudonym for iron tsuba. 81 Juyo, 7 Tokubetsu Juyo.

alternative_names: 後藤一乗; 伯応; Hakuō; Hakuo; 凸凹山人; Totsuo-sanjin
notes: Short signature for Goto Ichijo (see WGO042).

alternative_names: 横谷宗珉; 宗民; Sōmin; 友常; Tomotsune; 遯庵; Ton'an; 次兵衛; Jihei
notes: Founder of Machibori style (1670-1733). Invented katakiribori technique. Multiple generations exist.
